C1.description: System has distinct processing modules with different specializations

C2.description: Information from one module is broadcast to all others

C3.description: Limited capacity workspace forces competition for access

C4.description: Feedback connections allow information to flow back to earlier stages

C5.description: System integrates information across time through recurrence

C6.description: System has representations of its own mental states

C7.description: System maintains and updates a model of itself

C8.description: System models its own attention processes

C9.description: System has simplified model of its own awareness

C10.description: System has non-zero Phi (integrated information beyond its parts)

C11.description: System cannot be reduced to independent components without information loss

C12.description: System generates predictions and updates based on prediction errors

C13.description: System detects and responds to violations of expectations

C14.description: System models or implements quantum-classical boundary processes
